title: Error with Extracting Frames (DLC 2.2b6)

labels.name: more-data-requested-by-us
labels.description: We would like to get more data to answer

body:
Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "traceback" and input code that you ran to hit this error. **Information** Windows 10, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut 2.2b6 **Describe the problem** - importing DLC, opening GUI, and creating new project works fine. - when attempting to extract frames from the GUI, and after typing "yes", an error pops up saying "Frame extraction failed. Video files must be corrupted." - upon checking the video in my files however, the video loads and plays just fine. Please place code inside this: (I also added a screenshot below, under **Screenshots** > 2)
Code output

[In [1]: import deeplabcut In [2]: deeplabcut.__version__ Out[2]: '2.2b6' In [3]: deeplabcut.launch_dlc() Created "D:\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\d197test-david-2020-07-26\videos" Created "D:\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\d197test-david-2020-07-26\labeled-data" Created "D:\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\d197test-david-2020-07-26\training-datasets" Created "D:\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\d197test-david-2020-07-26\dlc-models" Copying the videos D:\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\d197test-david-2020-07-26\videos\D1-97.mov Generated "D:\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\d197test-david-2020-07-26\config.yaml" A new project with name d197test-david-2020-07-26 is created at D:\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU and a configurable file (config.yaml) is stored there. Change the parameters in this file to adapt to your project's needs. Once you have changed the configuration file, use the function 'extract_frames' to select frames for labeling. . [OPTIONAL] Use the function 'add_new_videos' to add new videos to your project (at any stage). Config file read successfully. Do you want to extract (perhaps additional) frames for video: D:\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\d197test-david-2020-07-26\videos\D1-97.mov ? yes/no yes Frame extraction failed. Video files must be corrupted.]

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Run Command Prompt as Administrator 2. Change directory to location of anaconda env 3. Type "activate DLC-GPU" 4. Type "ipython" 5: Type "import deeplabcut" 6: Type "deeplabcut.launch_dlc() 7: In the GUI, create a new project and check "Copy Videos" under Optional Attributes, click "Ok" 8: Once project is created, click the "Extract frames" tab on the GUI 9: Settings in order from left to right: (automatic, GUI, yes, yes, kmeans, 1, 25) 10: Click "Ok" after changing ^ settings. 11: Once "Do you want to extract ... yes/no" comes up in Command Prompt, type "yes" 12: **error occurs** **Screenshots** 1: Settings in GUI, "Extract frames": ![DLC Extract Frames](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68831269/88493929-b5707b80-cf81-11ea-80ce-55ce5d3b79be.png) 2: Image of Command Prompt + error: ![Command Prompt Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68831269/88493998-fe283480-cf81-11ea-8cab-b0c9083eb1d9.png) **Additional context** 1: I have tried updating DLC to 2.2b7, error persists 2: Cuda version 10.0 (which others have had success using DLC with) 3: I have tried using the Command Prompt to extract frames instead of using the GUI, error persists
